column1:
4.5.11	
Diagnostic evaluation of pelvic floor function
The ICS classification is suitable for clinical practice.

Over-activity of the pelvic floor muscles is related to chronic pelvic pain, prostate, bladder and vulvar 
pain.
Over-activity of the pelvic floor muscles is an input to the CNS causing central sensitisation.
There is no accepted standard for diagnosing myofascial trigger points.
There is a relation between the location of trigger point and the region where the pain is perceived.
